intro: Matricaria praecox, commonly known as the early chamomile, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its essential oils, derived from the flowers, are widely used in aromatherapy and herbal remedies.
